TaskDescription: Participants viewed a standard fixation cross in the center of the computer screen. The recorded voice of a female research assistant instructed them to 'now open your eyes' (rest with eyes open for 20 s) and 'now close your eyes' (rest with eyes closed for 40 s); this procedure was repeated 5 times, alternating between eyes opened and eyes closed. For purposes of analysis, we were mainly interested in the eyes-closed condition, due to the lower frequency of eye blinks. However, we interspersed the brief eyes-open blocks throughout the task in order to ensure that participants remained engaged for the duration of the task session.
Instructions: Fixate on the central cross. Open or close your eyes when you hear the request for it. Press to begin.
